title: High and low exercise intensity found to influence brain function differently
body:
https://www.dhresource.com/0x0/f2/albu/g2/M00/77/61/rBVaGlSXxdmAVm4HAAYHIVZUEIE965.jpg

https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2020/01/200130115430.htm

>researchers discovered that low-intensity exercise triggers brain networks involved in cognition control and attention processing, while high-intensity exercise primarily activates networks involved in affective/emotion processing.

So maybe if you did some more exercise you'd be able to handle your emotions and you wouldn't be as depressed or anxious.
